New Records: Quinton de Kock scored his 15th T20I half-century, and the second half-century by a South African at this T20 World Cup
Key Match Events: Kagiso Rabada took 3 wickets for 18 runs, including the wicket of Andries Gous off the first delivery of the penultimate over
Quinton de Kock hit 5 sixes and 3 fours in the powerplay to help South Africa to 64 for the loss of one wicket
Post-Match Reflections: The Proteas' next game is against England in Saint Lucia on Friday, a win there would ensure the Proteas have one foot in the T20 World Cup semifinals
Miscellaneous Highlights: South Africa set a massive total of 194 for the loss of four wickets in their 20 overs, their highest score of the tournament
The USA needed 92 runs off the final six overs, chasing 195 runs to win
Others: South Africa's spearhead Kagiso Rabada finished with three wickets while conceding only 18 runs in his four overs
Quinton de Kock's knock of 74 off 40 deliveries helped South Africa to a solid victory in the opening match of the Super Eight stage of the T20 World Cup
